did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The Georgetown Churches Collection contains information related to Georgetown's Bethlehem Evangelical Lutheran, Bible, Covenant (Swedish) Congregational, Gilbert Memorial Congregational, Methodist Episcopal, and Sacred Heart Catholic churches.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the G&B Cultural Center.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item Description, Date], Georgetown Churches Collection, [Item no., Box no.], G&B Cultural Center, Wilton, Conn.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The earliest of Georgetown's churches in this collection was founded in the late 1700s, and the most recent in the mid-1900s. The Methodist Episcopal Church dates to 1790, the Sacred Heart Catholic to 1870, the Covenant (Swedish) Congregational to 1889, the Bethlehem Evangelical Lutheran to 1900, the Gilbert Memorial Congregational to 1902 and the Bible Church - the successor to the Gilbert Memorial - to 1964.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Georgetown Churches Collection contains programs of worship, informational pamphlets, newspaper clippings, fundraising materials, books and papers, photographs, and postcards.

controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
